required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Kidney Injury in Coronavirus Disease-19 (COVID-19) Patients Admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU)
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Kidney Injury in COVID-19 Patients Admitted to the ICU: a Multicenter Cohort Analysis in 9 Large Hospitals in Belgium

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the rate and outcomes of COVID-19 associated acute kidney injury (AKI) and use of kidney replacement therapy (KRT) in critically ill COVID-19 patients in ICUs in several large hospitals in Flanders, the northern region of Belgium. We will also explore the associations between several baseline risk factors for AKI, therapeutic strategies and COVID-19 related clinical signs and the occurrence of AKI and use of KRT.

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate the rate and outcomes of COVID-19 associated acute kidney injury (AKI) and use of kidney replacement therapy (KRT) in critically ill COVID-19 patients in ICUs in several large hospitals in Flanders, the northern region of Belgium. We will also explore the associations between several baseline risk factors for AKI, therapeutic strategies and COVID-19 related clinical signs and the occurrence of AKI and use of KRT.
This will be a cohort analysis of the rate of COVID-19 associated AKI and KRT during the period 1 February 2020 - 31 January 2021 in 6 large hospitals in Flanders Belgium and 3 Flemish University Hospitals. We will collect patients' baseline characteristics, specific treatment for COVID-19, other relevant therapies and severity of illness and ICU and hospital outcome data. AKI will be assessed during ICU stay up to 21 days of ICU stay, and will be defined according to the Kidney Disease: Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO) definition. In addition, we will assess occurrence of AKI stages, duration of AKI, duration of AKI integrated with severity stage of AKI into the area under the curve of AKI, occurrence of rapid reversal of AKI, occurrence of Acute Kidney Disease (AKD) defined according to KDIGO.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 21 of ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: AKI occurrence and severity stages defined according to KDIGO
use of KRT and eGFR in patients without AKI (no AKI), AKI, and AKI stages
Mortality of AKI and no AKI patients will be compared

primary_outcome.time_frame: AKI and AKD will be classified up to day 21 of ICU stay, and survival will be assessed up to day 30 or hospital discharge whichever is last
primary_outcome.description: Survival of no AKI, AKI and AKI stages, AKD, and rapid reversal up to day 30 or hospital discharge whichever comes last

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 21 of ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: AKI occurrence and severity stages defined according to KDIGO creatinine criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) urine output criteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 21 of ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: AKI occurrence and severity stages defined according to KDIGO urine output criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 21 of ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of AKI for 48-h or less

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 21 of ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and severity staging of AKD according to KDIGO criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 21 of ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of AKI-AUC which is defined as the sum of the daily maximum severity stage of AKI
Mortality of patients with AKD and severity stages of AKD will be compared to no AKI and patients with AKI and different AKI stages
Mortality of patients with AKI rapid reversal ill be compared to no AKI and patients with AKI and different AKI stages
Mortality of patients with AKI stage 2 or greater and patients with no AKI or AKI stage 1 will be compared
Mortality of patients with AKI treated with KRT and patients with no AKI or AKI stage 1, 2 or 3 will be compared

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality AKI creatinine criteria versus urine output criteria versus full KDIGO
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality of patients with AKI and patients with no AKI will be compared
Mortality of quartiles of AKI-AUC will be assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Kidney outcome AKI KDIGO creatinine or urine output
secondary_outcome.description: use of KRT and eGFR in no AKI, AKI on creatinine or urine output criteria and AKI stages, Rapid Reversal of AKI, and AKD and stages

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 21 of ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of AKI, AKI on creatinine or urine output criteria and AKI stages, Rapid Reversal of AKI, and AKD and stages

secondary_outcome.time_frame: AKI-AUC will be assessed up to day 21 of ICU stay, and survival will be assessed up to day 30 or hospital discharge whichever is last
secondary_outcome.description: Survival up to day 30 or hospital discharge (whichever is last) for quartiles of AKI-AUC will be assessed
Recovery of AKI, AKI stages, AKD and AKD stages, KRT will be assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Timing of AKI, AKI severity grades and use of KRT
secondary_outcome.description: timing of occurrence of AKI in relation to onset of symptoms, hospital admission, ICU admission
initial modality of KRT and anticoagulation used
number of KRT treatment days, and KRT free days
outcomes will be assessed in patients with and without mechanical ventilation at time of start of AKI

secondary_outcome.measure: Subgroup analysis: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) (estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR)<60 mL/min)
secondary_outcome.description: outcomes will be assessed in patients with and without CKD as baseline kidney function
outcomes will be assessed in patients older and younger than 65y
outcomes will be assessed in obese patients and non-obese
outcomes will be assessed in patients treated with mechanical ventilation and in prone position
outcomes will be assessed in patients treated with ECMO

arm_group.description: Critical COVID-19 patients admitted to the ICU

intervention.intervention_name: Observational study exploring the epidemiology and outcomes of AKI in critical COVID-19 patients admitted to the ICU
intervention.description: Critical COVID-19 patients admitted to the ICU

study_pop.textblock: All consecutive Critical COVID-19 patients admitted to the ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome CoronaVirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection confirmed by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) on nasopharyngeal swab or oropharyngeal swab or rectal swab or bronchoalveolar aspirate
- admission to the ICU for monitoring or organ support
Exclusion Criteria:
- asymptomatic COVID-19 patients admitted to the ICU for medical reason not related to COVID-19

patient_data.ipd_description: Investigators may propose additional analyses on the dataset. These proposals will be evaluated by the 2 study chairs Eric Hoste and Greet De Vlieger and the study group for eligibility
